Our bill to #EndFossilFuelSubsidies will:

1. Increase the competitiveness of the energy industry

2. Combat the #ClimateCrisis, lower emissions, and protect public health

3. Ensure the United States is no longer subsidizing carbon emissions at the expense of everyone else.
Despite all this, according to the IMF, fossil fuels continue to receive nearly **$650 billion** per year in direct and indirect subsidies from the United States.

What’s the rush to #EndFossilFuelSubsidies? 

Fossil fuels are the largest producer of greenhouse gas by far. 

In 2018 alone, the U.S. emitted more than 6.5 billion tons of greenhouse gases, contributing to the wildfires, floods and hurricanes we’re now dealing with.

As wildfires rage across the West & hurricanes batter the Gulf Coast, ending taxpayer subsidies to oil and gas companies is a crucial element of #SolvingTheClimateCrisis that also will also save taxpayers billions.
NEW: @RepBlumenauer and I just introduced legislation to #EndFossilFuelSubsidies that currently fuel the climate crisis with taxpayer dollars.

This bill authorizes $805 million in grants and other funding to support research, improving the pipeline of culturally competent providers, build outreach programs that reduce stigma, and develop a training program for providers to effectively manage disparities.

16/ They did that from the start and felt much less economic pain because it's way cheaper to control the spread of a virus before it spreads.  We should have, and if Trump hadn't politicized science we would have too.

15/ Namely: Test.  Contact Trace.  Wear a mask.  Social distance.  Provide quarantine housing for those who are infected.  We don't need to do any science to know whether that works - those countries have already proven it works.

14/ And here's the thing: we don't have to do that.  We can simply follow the examples that New Zealand, South Korea and so many other countries of done that has gotten the virus under control, even without a vaccine.

13/ 6% x 209 million = 12.5 million dead Americans.  That is the population of New York and Los Angeles combined.  That is the price you have to be willing to bear if you embrace herd immunity as a disease management strategy.   It.  Is.  Brutal.

12/ We've learned a lot about ventilator management and treatment, but there is simply no way that a 30x increase in COVID infection rates doesn't overload hospitals.  To assume death rates will be <6% is naive at best, evil at worst.

11/ Today, almost 3% of Americans who get infected are dying.  But remember back in March when we were talking about the need to flatten the curve and hospitals were getting overloaded?  The death rate then was >6%.

10/ If we are to get to the ~65% infection rate that seems to be required for herd immunity, we will need to infect 65% x 332M, or 216 million Americans.  Put another way, that's 209 million Americans more than we have already.

9/ To be sure, there are more infections we don't know about.  And the excess deaths above average suggest that our death rate from COVID is also substantially undercounted.  But let's go with the data we have.  https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/official-us-coronavirus-death-toll-is-a-substantial-undercount-of-actual-tally-new-yale-study-finds.html

8/ So now let's do some math.  As of this morning, according to Johns Hopkins there are just over 7 million confirmed COVID cases in the United States, or ~2.2% of the population.  Over 200,000 Americans have died, or 2.9% of those infected. https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html

7/ This value is confirmed by a similar outbreak in Qatar where scientists concluded that "some communities" "have reached or nearly reached" herd immunity at infection rates of 65 - 70%.  https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.09.24.20200543v2.full.pdf

6/ However, we do have a few recent studies that should scare the pants off you.  After a surge in cases in Brazil, scientists concluded that "...up to 70%..." of the population may need to be exposed to achieve herd immunity.  https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-brazil-manaus/in-brazils-amazon-a-covid-19-resurgence-dashes-herd-immunity-hopes-idUSKBN26I0I4

5/ To know that, you have to know whether the virus will involve and how durable your immunity is once infected (assuming you are one of the lucky ones who doesn't die.)  As former CDC director Tom Frieden points out here, we don't know those answers. https://www.drtomfrieden.net/blog/a-dozen-observations-about-covid-19-immunity

4/ But let us suppose for a moment that you are completely amoral and you view economic growth as paramount, no matter how many people die.  How many people would have to get infected in order to achieve herd immunity in that dystopian future?

3/ This frankly isn't surprising.  If lots of your neighbors are getting sick and dying from a contagious disease, you will be inclined to stay indoors, avoid restaurants, theaters and retail shops.  You cannot grow the economy in the midst of a raging public health crisis.

2/ The idea that we can choose to kill people or grow our economy is also wrong.  Sweden, famously has tried to pursue herd immunity and only managed to kill more Swedes and hurt their economy. 
https://www.medpagetoday.com/infectiousdisease/covid19/88401 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjFcQrgWoAEmWBe.png

Today, several bipartisan bills that I sponsored were debated on the House Floor and passed through a suspension of the rules. See below to learn more about these important pieces of legislation.
In 2016, an estimated 11% of all ER patients displayed suicidal ideation but only 3% were identified and linked with treatment. Thanks to @ENAorg for bringing this problem to my attention.
The Effective Screening Suicide Screening & Assessment in the Emergency Department Act creates a uniform screening tool to assess patients in the ER for suicide risk.

An impressive 22 therapies have been approved since the PRV’s inception in 2012. Pediatric cancer remains the #1 cause of death in American children, with thousands of children lost to cancer each year. We can do better! Thanks to @EveryLifeOrg & @KIDSvCANCER for the support!

The Creating Hope Reauthorization Act reauthorizes the #PriorityReviewVoucher (PRV) program for rare pediatric diseases for four more years. PRV incentivizes the development of cures for childhood cancer.

The STAND-UP Act has a goal to identify threats before they materialize & ensure at-risk students get the mental health treatment they need. These programs reduce bullying, suicide & campus violence. A special thanks to @SandyHookPromise Foundation for its support.
